Description: PRODUCE FOR BROADCAST, EIGHT EPISODES OF THE FREE-TO-AIR STEM TELEVISION PROGRAM FOR YOUTH IN AFRICA.  EACH EPISODE OF THE N*GEN: TV SHOW, FUNDED BY THE U.S. MISSION WILL SHOWCASE U.S. PROGRAMMATIC INVESTMENTS IN AFRICA, INCLUDING AMERICAN INNOVATIONS.

THE CHUNGUZA MEDIA PROJECT, AIMS TO INCREASE QUALITY AND QUANTITY OF INVESTIGATIVE JOURNALISM STORIES FOR ACCOUNTABILITY THROUGH SUPPORT AND NURTURING OF JOURNALISTS TO PRODUCE STORIES WITH MORE FOCUS ON STRATEGIC PROJECTS.
SETTING UP OF A GARDEN AND AQUARIUM THAT WILL BE PART OF THE THERAPEUTIC TREATMENT OF STUDENTS WITH EPILEPSY.

TO SUPPORTS THE FIGHT AGAINST ILLEGAL, UNREPORTED AND UNREGULATED (IUU) FISHING THROUGH SUPPORT FOR THE GROWING BLUE ECONOMY IN SADC INCLUDING COMBATTING AND PREVENTING CRIMES COMMITTED BY VESSELS SUBSIDIZED BY PEOPLE REPUBLIC OF CHINA.

THE TANZANIA ICT PARTNERSHIP ALIGNS WITH USG GOALS TO STRENGTHEN INTERNATIONAL PARTNERSHIPS IN IMPROVING DIGITAL CONNECTIVITY, PROMOTING STABLE AND SECURE CYBERSPACE, AND UPHOLDING DIGITAL DEMOCRACY AND FREEDOMS.
